instructions: Add salt to the flour and sift.
Combine the flour and the slightly beaten egg in a bowl.
Mix with a fork until it starts to come together, then knead with your hands until the dough is smooth and resembles putty.
Wrap the dough in a cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Dust a breadboard or countertop generously with flour.
Roll out the dough thinly, repeating the process 5-6 times, making it thinner with each roll. Aim for the dough to be thin enough to see light through.
If the dough is still moist after rolling, let it air dry for a few minutes.
Fold the dough a few times and slice into desired noodle width.
Toss the cut noodles with flour to prevent sticking.
Boil the noodles in heavily salted water for 30 seconds to a few minutes, depending on thickness, until cooked through.
cooking_tips: For crispier noodles, fry some thinly sliced dried noodles in hot oil until brown and sprinkle them on top of the boiled noodles.
Boiled noodles can be served with various sauces like brown sauce, tomato sauce, or a garlic and tomato sauce.
The thinner the noodles are rolled, the faster they will cook.
Be careful not to roll the dough so thin that it tears.
